title.rendered: The Itch.io store does not mince words against NFTs: “they are a scam”

content.rendered:
We are at Monday and we already have the first statement against the NFT. Last week there were several open fronts, highlighting that of Team17 with their NFT Worms. The popular rejection of the community and from the studios caused its withdrawal, at the same time that Konami has shown its support for continuing to sell this class of products.

Now, one of the most important platforms in the industry has spoken. Itch.iothe portal that brings together the largest number of independent titles and developers, has shown its rejection of the NFT. And in this case they have not mince words since their directive.

Also f̸̗̎ú̴̩c̷̖͌ḳ̵̀ any company that says they support creators and also endorses NFTs in any way. They only care about their own profit and the opportunity for wealth above anyone else.

Especially given the now easily available discourse concerning the problems of NFTs.

— itch.io (@itchio) February 6, 2022

Some have asked about our position on NFTs:

NFTs are a scam. If you think they are truly useful for anything other than exploiting creators, financial scams, and destroying the planet, we ask you to re-evaluate your life choices.

Peace.

Also fuck any company that claims to support creators and also supports NFTs in any way. They only care about their own benefit and opportunity for wealth above anyone else. Especially considering the now easier discourse on the problems of NFTs.

It is clear that Itch.io did not like at all that some companies like Ubisoft or Square Enix have shown their support for NFTs. Among the arguments of the platform we find the always mentioned speculation around the NFT marketas well as the negative consequences of its use on the environment.

On the other hand, they are not cut when it comes to point out any company that establishes links with NFTs. The future of the industry is also determined by the metaverses, a model that Microsoft wants to lead and that Nintendo is not sure how to take advantage of.
